result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas T Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay  $500.00 fine plus costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------

Reimburse cost of HIV Testing in the amount of $148.03.
------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------------

No contact with the victim or the victim's family. Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Any prescription medications to be made known to the Agent and taken as prescribed.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------
**AMENDED ON 02-25-2015 TO REFLECT: The Defendant is EXEMPT from registering as a sex offender. This exemption was used under Statute 301.45.
------------------------------
**2nd AMENDMENT 03-17-2015 - Defendant is to submit to appropriate test for herpes. State to file order with attachment and defense will have 60 days to review order and provide response and/or objection.

Any claim for restitution is held open for sixty (60) days and is subject to the Defendant's right to challenge.
-----------------------------
**AMENDMENT 03-17-2015: IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT restitution is set at $3,522.65, joint and several with co-actors, and is subject to the Defendant's right to challenge within 60 days. Restitution is held open for sixty (60) days. **NOTE: All restitution is to be paid through the Department of Corrections. All other court obligations were previously paid in full.
-----------------------------
**2nd AMENDMENT 05-14-2015 - PAYMENT TOWARD RESTITUTION RECEIVED IN THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,526.49. This amount has been disbursed to the victims through the Clerk of Court's Office. **PLEASE NOTE; ANY BALANCE DUE OF RESTITUTION MUST BE PAID THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS**
-----------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence within twenty-four (24) hours, or no later than 3:00 pm on January 13, 2015. **NOTE: Court STAYS six (6) months of the conditional release jail time for Agent's use.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDMENT 11/28/2018 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect credit in the amount of 789 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Not to possess any dangerous weapons or firearms.
------------------------------------------

No contact with victim, victim's family or their residence. 
-------------------------------------------
Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed.
-------------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
-------------------------------------------
Sex offender treatment as recommended by Agent.
-------------------------------------------
Defendant is exempt from registering as a sex offender pursuant to exemption in Sec. 301.45.
-------------------------------------------

$500.00 fine plus costs including supervision fees less any amounts previously paid.
-------------------------------------------

Restitution has been paid in full and disbursed to victim.
-------------------------------------------

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment form filed

1:30 pm  Defendant Nicholas T Cook in court, in custody with attorney Jenelle L. Glasbrenner.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim is present and State is in compliance with Chap 950.
Both sides have reviewed revocation summary.
State has also reviewed alternate PSI and Attorney Glasbrenner notes the writer is present.
Court gives WARNINGS regarding felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor pursuant to Sec. 941.291.
1:33 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by ADA Johnson.
1:43 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Glasbrenner.
1:59 pm  Tests results provided to Court for review.
2:09 pm  Defendant makes statement to Court.
2:12 pm  Court goes over sentencing factors.
2:26 pm  Court does not have authority to order sex offender registration after original sentence has been imposed.
2:28 pm  Court imposes following sentence:

Eighteen (18) years in Wisconsin State Prison System bifurcated as seven (7) years Initial Confinement followed by eleven (11) years Extended Probation
Seven hundred eighty-six (786) days dead time credit
Defendant is NOT eligible for CIP or SAP.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

$500 fine plus costs including supervision fees less any amount previously paid
Restitution has been paid in full and disbursed to victim
No contact with victim, victim's family or their residence.
Not to possess or consume alcohol
Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
Counseling as recommended by Agent 
Sex offender treatment as recommended by Agent
Not to possess any dangerous weapons or firearms
Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed
Defendant is exempt from registering as a sex offender pursuant to exemption in Sec. 301.45.

Copy of Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence provided to defendant.

**PARTIAL TRANSCRIPT FILED 11/7/18: COURT REPORTER JANET SCHULZ**

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Imposing Jail Time per the Alternative Revocation Agreement

3:40 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Defendant Nicholas T Cook in court, in custody with attorney Jenelle Lynn Glasbrenner.  Jean Jacobs, Probation and Parole Agent.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court on the Defendant's request relating to an Order from DOC to impose jail time as a condition of probation based upon Mr. Cooks voluntary signing of a voluntary agreement to serve jail time as an alternative to revocation.   Court is asking for legal authority for the Court to intervene between the Defendant and the Agent.  Attorney Johnson agrees with the recommendations of the Department.  Attorney Johnson has a list of the numerous violations of the Defendant and itemizes his rule violations.  Attorney Glasbrenner is requesting that the Court allow Mr. Cook to serve the jail time with work release.  Argument by Attorney Glasbrenner.    
3:51 p.m., Argument by Attorney Glasbrenner regarding imposition of remaining 6 months jail as ATR with work release privileges.
3:55 p.m., Statement by ADA Johnson.  Statements by Agent Jacobs regarding probation history and violations.  
4:00 p.m., Argument by Attorney Glasbrenner.
4:06 p.m., Statements by Agent Jacobs.
4:08 p.m., Statements by the Court.  Court denies request for work release privileges with credit from 02-11-2016.
4:10 p.m., Court in recess.

PURSUANT TO STIPULATION AND ORDER FILED ON 05-22-2014, IT IS ORDERED THAT the defendant shall be allowed to have contact with co-actors, Gage Timmer and Braden Mann for the sole purpose of Richard Mann's visitation and funeral on May 22 & 23, 2014. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Defendant is prohibited from discussing the facts of this case during its pendency with Gage Timmer and Braden Mann. The Defendant's father SHALL be present with the Defendant at ALL TIMES. All other conditions of bond shall remain the same.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.A.D., 2/2/1999.
